channel.title: Whoopi Goldberg on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Contractually Obligated to Suck
item.description: [whitebox] [big]Today in Tedium: The TV network ABC Family is a family network in the loosest of senses. For years, it’s mostly focused on one particular element of that family—the older teens and young adults that make up the massive wave of millennials that appeal so much to advertisers. In fact, the term “Family” barely made sense—which is why the network decided recently to change its name to Freeform, a change that takes effect early next year.
